metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5339 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Check_MK before 1.2.4p4 and 1.2.5 before 1.2.5i4 allows remoteauthenticated users to write check_mk config files (.mk files) to arbitrarylocations via vectors related to row selections.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

check-mk-agent - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-agent-logwatch - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-config-icinga - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-config-nagios3 - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-livestatus - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-multisite - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-server - 1.2.6p12-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: check-mk package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.6p12-1').
